ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I better understand how to craft a well written essay in several different fields (ie. personal, location, etc.).
Implementing writing skills to make personal essays captivating and meaningful.
We learned how to analyze an essay more for its craft than its content. I also learned the importance of peer feedback and revisions.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I like the structure of the assignments and I think maybe the timing of feedback could be improved.

Strengths: 
- The essays assigned give are great examples of writing (and, for the most part, interesting)
- You always get a first and final draft which the part of the class that helped me learn the most

Weaknesses: 
- Because each professor is different, it can be difficult to tell what they're looking for in a paper. I found Professor Saraceni to be very specific in what she looked for, and I was able to work my rewrites around her feedback.
- What you gain from reading essays is determined my class discussion, which can sometimes be unproductive

The small discussion format really facilitated a close environment between all of the students which made it a lot easier to share my work with the class. However, the course could benefit from some variety (ex: less discussions, more activities, etc.).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It is a great course on reading good essays and writing good essays.

As a STEM student, I was a bit nervous to take ENGL 120. Even though I suffered through most of the class, I am glad I took it. I am definitely a better writer because of it, even it was out of my comfort zone.
Yes! I would recommend this course. I have never taken a "craft" class before, and I learned that I really enjoyed this style of approaching writing.
